channel.title: Among the Hidden series
channel.description:
Perfect for readers of ages 11-16.
This is the only series I like. 10/10.
By Margret Peterson Haddix

item.title: Among the Hidden series
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

[quote=“Unid H4x0r, post:6, topic:236391”][quote author=Tico135 link=topic=311945.msg2486510#msg2486510 date=1223862614]
Perhaps describing to us what the books are about, and possibly the main idea of each book in order to allow us to decide whether or not this series would suit us.
[/quote]
Why not Google it if you really want to find out about it?[/quote]

I don’t believe I should have to, seeing as this a section where he is asked to Review the book, (ie summarize) so we don’t HAVE to go looking for it ourselves. It may sound like spoon-feeding, but it’s really just explaining the plot.

Read full topic

item.title: Among the Hidden series
item.dc:creator: @Unid_H4x0r Unid H4x0r
item.description:
@Unid_H4x0r wrote:

Tico135:

Perhaps describing to us what the books are about, and possibly the main idea of each book in order to allow us to decide whether or not this series would suit us.

Why not Google it if you really want to find out about it?

Overview

Among the Hidden is a thought-provoking story set in of the not too distant future that explores the choices and challenges faced by an early adolescent boy as he struggles to find his place in a world in which his existence is illegal. Luke, a third child, lives in a future where each family is allowed to have only two children. Because his parents broke the population laws when they let him live, Luke must stay hidden in his house, has never been to school, must eat in the attic stairwell to avoid being seen, and must spend his days with nothing to do except re-read a few old books and observe his neighborhood through the attic air…


Sounds pretty decent…

[quote=“Cruzer, post:4, topic:236391”]i like a book

it is good

i give it a 10[/quote]Doing a pk4pk impersonation doesn’t make you any smarter then him.
